abstract: Rodelis Therapeutics,which bought tuberculosis drug cycloserine from nonprofit Purdue Research Foundation and promptly raised price from $500 to $10,800 for 30 capsules, agrees to give drug back to foundation, which will raise price to only $1,050; Turing Pharmaceuticals, which bought and dramatically raised price of drug Daraprim, is unapologetic about move;  relatively new business strategy of buying old drugs and raising prices has been widely condemned.
lead_paragraph: Rodelis, which acquired cycloserine and promptly raised its price more than twentyfold, returned it to the foundation that had previously owned the drug.

headline.main: Big Price Increase for Tuberculosis Drug Is Rescinded
headline.print_headline: Price Increase Rescinded for a Tuberculosis Drug

snippet: Rodelis, which acquired cycloserine and promptly raised its price more than twentyfold, returned it to the foundation that had previously owned the drug....
